metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29535 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Following a Garbage Collector compaction, weak maps may have been accessedbefore they were correctly traced. This resulted in memory corruption and apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112,Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112,and Thunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
